member.summary: Gets the list of completions that are part of this completion set.
member.remarks: When overriding this property, if you would like to provide a dynamic collection of completions, take care to implement for your collection of completions. The default completion presenter uses to listen for changes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.CompletionSet.CompletionBuilders
member.summary: Gets the list of completion builders that are part of this completion set.
member.remarks: Completion builders are completions that are displayed separately from the other completions in the completion set. In the default presentation, completion builders appear in a non-scrolled list above the scrolled list of completions. When overriding this property, if you would like to provide a dynamic collection of completion builders, take care to implement for your collection of completion builders. The default completion presenter uses to listen for changes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ICompletionBroker
member.summary: Represents the central broker responsible for statement completion.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ICompletionBroker.TriggerCompletion(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Editor.ITextView)
member.summary: Starts the process of statement completion, assuming the caret position to be the position at which completions should be inserted.
member.param: The over which to trigger statement completion.
member.returns: A valid statement completion session. May be null if no session could be created.
member.remarks: When the caret leaves the applicability span of all the completions in this session, the session will be automatically dismissed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ICompletionBroker.TriggerCompletion(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Editor.ITextView,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.ITrackingPoint,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts the process of statement completion at a particular position. When called with a specific trigger point, caret movements will be ignored and the broker will not be responsible for dismissing the session.
member.param: The over which to trigger statement completion.
The point in the text buffer at which statement completion is requested.
true if this session should track the caret, false otherwise. When the caret is tracked, only completion items whose applicability span contains the caret will be displayed.
member.returns: A valid statement completion session. May be null if no session could be created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ICompletionBroker.CreateCompletionSession(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Editor.ITextView,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.ITrackingPoint,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a completion session, but does not start it.
member.param: The over which to create a completion session.
The point in the text buffer at which statement completion is requested.
true if this session should track the caret, false otherwise. When the caret is tracked, only completion items whose applicability span contains the caret will be displayed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.IWpfKeyboardTrackingService
member.summary: Defines a MEF service responsible for tracking the keyboard in hosts of the WPF editor. Keyboard tracking is necessary as some hosts (such as VisualStudio) do their own keyboard handling, causing inconsistent behavior of WPF elements, even when they have keyboard focus. By tracking the keyboard, all keyboard events will be routed to WPF first, giving focused WPF controls a shot at handling keyboard events.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.INavigableSymbolSource.GetNavigableSymbolAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously gets an at the trigger span position.
member.param: A 1-character length span over which navigable symbol is queried.
A used to cancel the task as needed.
member.returns: A task that returns upon completion.

remarks.para: This async method is called on background thread.

The is a 1-character span containing the character over which a symbol is queried. This is to disambiguate the case in a projection buffer where the trigger point is between two buffer boundaries and thus multiple symbol sources may be queried. A span eliminates this ambiguity because it can only fall in one buffer.
Providers may return a with null results if no navigable symbol is available over the queried .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.IPeekableItem
member.summary: Represents an object (for instance a symbol in a document) that can be a source of a .
member.remarks: Content-type specific Peek providers define concrete implementations holding onto all the context they need to provide s for the item referenced at the 's trigger point and relationship. When an is triggered, s matching the document's content type will be called in order (defined by the content type specificity and Order attributes) to analyze the 's trigger point and relationship. If an recognizes the trigger point as a location of an item the provider can provide s for the relationship, it creates its concrete instance capturing all the necessary context and adds it to the . Then the Peek provider will be called to provide s given this instance.

member.summary: Provides source for a text buffer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.IPeekResultPresenter
member.summary: Defines presenter, which can create WPF visual representation of a Peek result.

remarks.para: Each specific implementation needs an that can create a visual representation of the result to be shown inside the Peek control. The Peek service exports default s for known implementations such as and . When a content type specific Peek provider provides a custom implementation it should also export an that can create its visual representation. It is also possible to override existing using the Order attribute.

This is a MEF component part, and should be exported with the following attributes: [Export(typeof(IPeekResultPresenter))] [Name("presenter name")] [Order()] Name attribute is required and Order attribute is optional.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ISuggestedAction
member.summary: A possible action suggested to be performed. Examples of such suggested actions include quick fixes for syntax errors, suggestions aimed on improving code quality or refactorings. Suggested actions are provided by instances and represented by a LightBulb presenter as menu items in a LightBulb dropdown menu.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ISuggestedAction.HasActionSets
member.summary: Gets whether this action has nested suggested action sets.
member.remarks: This property is expected to be fast so if calculating the return value is not trivial it's recommended to just return true and delay evaluating real list of nested actions until method is called. In other words, the scenario of returning true and returning null or empty list is supported. On the other hand, if this property returns false, method will not be called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ISuggestedAction.GetActionSetsAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a list of nested sets of suggested actions.
member.returns: A task whose result is either a list of s representing nested suggested actions, or null if this instance has no nested suggested actions.

member.summary: Gets the localized text representing the suggested action.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ISuggestedAction.InputGestureText
member.summary: Gets the text describing an input gesture that will apply the suggested action.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ISuggestedAction.HasPreview
member.summary: Gets whether this suggested action can provide a preview via method call.
member.remarks: This property is expected to be fast so if calculating the return value is not trivial it's recommended to just return true and delay evaluating whether a preview can be provided until method is called. In other words, the scenario of returning true and returning null is supported. On the other hand, if this property returns false, method will not be called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ISuggestedAction.GetPreviewAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets an object visually representing a preview of the suggested action.
member.param: A cancellation token that allows to cancel preview creation.

remarks.para: The only currently supported type of preview object is .

By default preview panel gets highlighted when focused by setting background color to . When providing a preview object make sure it doesn't set different background for the whole preview content, otherwise it's recommended that preview object indicates focused state using color.

member.returns: A task whose result is an object visually representing a preview of the suggested action, or null if no preview can be provided.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.ISuggestedActionsSourceProvider
member.summary: Defines a provider of a suggested actions source.
member.remarks:
This is a MEF component part, and should be exported with the following attribute:
[Export(typeof(ISuggestedActionsSourceProvider))] [Order] [Name] [ContentType]
If this component returns an instance of , then it should be exported with one or more s, for example:
[Priority(DefaultOrderings.Default)] . You must specify the ContentType so that the source provider creates sources for buffers of content types that it recognizes, and Order to specify the order in which the sources (excluding ) are called. You must specify one or more Priority to ensure deterministic ordering of actions (if using ).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Language.Intellisense.SuggestedActionCategoryToIconDefinition
member.summary: Associates a LightBulb control icon for a suggested action category.
member.remarks: s are associations between s and s that define an icon for a particular . Icons are inheritable and icons defined for base categories will be displayed for their children as well, unless the child defines its own icon. Icon definitions are joined with category definitions on the Name attribute. The category's precedence determines which category's icon is displayed in the LightBulb control.
